title: Malcolm Guite - Soul in Paraphrase, Heart in Pilgrimage
description:
Malcolm Guite is a poet, priest, scholar, songwriter, educator, and traveler-on-foot. He's the author of several books, including most recently Heaven in Ordinary, a collection of essays. 

During the Covid lockdown, Guite created a YouTube series called A Spell in the Library, in which the viewer is invited to join him in his home study for a drink, a chat, and a ramble through his dense and  beautiful collection of books.

And Mr. Guite delighted TheCommonToad by agreeing to drop by the podcast the other day and...well...have a drink, a chat, and a ramble through the bookshelves. We talked about poetry, song, Leonard Cohen, Tolkien, C.S. Lewis & the Inklings, Malcolm's recent pilgrimage, and more. 

1:32 – We toast to Malcolm Guite's new book, Heaven in Ordinary
2:54 – A Spell in the Library
4:58 – Malcolm: “poetry precedes literacy,” and the poem-song connection
14:08 – Where to start with poetry
26:45 – Tolkien, C.S. Lewis, and the Inklings were looking forward, not backward
37:57 – Belief, agnosticism, and Leonard Cohen
49:34 – Diagnosing and tending to our era's crisis of meaning
58:29 –  … while avoiding mere nostalgia for the past
1:06:36 – Traveling on foot, and Malcolm's recent pilgrimage
